Name: Aaron J. Harding, MS
Full Bio:
Aaron J Harding, MS is a retired naval officer and clinical laboratory scientist professional with a son diagnosed with SynGAP1 Syndrome in 2013. He and his wife, Monica, additionally have two daughters and reside in San Diego, CA. He received his masters from George Washington University in immunohematology. An active leader within the SynGAP1 community since 2014, he served in several positions within Bridge the Gap, including co-lead of the NORD/FDA SYNGAP1 Data Registry. During his 29 years of naval service which includes deployments in U.S. Central Command, he has been awarded the Joint Defense Meritorious Service Medal (2), Navy Meritorious Service Medal (2), Joint Commendation Medal and Navy Commendation Medal (2). He has several publications in the Clinical Laboratory Sciences and Armed Services Blood Program.

Read this article about Aaron job running a major lab.

Email: Aaron@syngapresearchfund.org
LinkedIn



Aaron & Mike talking about SRF at the American Epilepsy Society meeting where SRF had their first Roundtable.

Name: Anthony Graglia
Full Bio:
Anthony makes things, beautifully: websites, graphics, 3D-printed objects. He lives with his wife and children in Germany and his nephew has SynGAP.

LinkedIn


‍

Name: Ashley Evans, MPhil, MBA
Full Bio:
Ashley Evans is a career investor, focused on private equity transactions in large technology businesses. She joined The Carlyle Group in 2006 and currently serves on the Boards of Directors of HireVue, ZoomInfo and Veritas. She received her MBA from Stanford’s Graduate School of Business, her MPhil from Cambridge, and her AB from Harvard College.

Ashley’s five-year-old son Tony was diagnosed with SynGAP-1 in 2018. Ashley and her husband Mike founded SRF to help Tony and others suffering from SynGAP-1 and related diseases.


See these articles featuring Ashley in Buyouts & Business Insider.

Ashley reflected on her journey with SRF in an interview with Kayo Conferences.

‍

Ashley & Mike used this video to launch SRF.

‍

‍

Name: Ashley Frye, MBA
Full Bio:
Ashley is a mother of two boys, Liam and Nathan- Syngapian. Located in Oxford, MS, she is using her professional experience to bring awareness and fundraising capabilities to SRF.

Ashley says "My son Nathan was diagnosed with SynGAP1 in December of 2020 at age 3.5 after an EEG identified epileptic activity. He has been developmentally delayed since he was six months old. I’ve been a staunch advocate for Nathan his entire life, knowing that something just wasn’t right. Now that we have a diagnosis, I will be an even harder working advocate for him and all the other SynGAP1 families until we have a clinical trial for therapeutic treatment."

Name: Chris Lableu - Texas
Full Bio:
Chris LaBleu is in Solutions Architect Manager for a Global SAAS Backup and Security company and previously was the Director of Information Technology for the Texas Heart Institute in the Texas Medical Center. He currently resides along with his family in Cypress, TX a suburb of Houston.

Krisstine, their 6-year-old daughter was diagnosed with Syngap1 in 2014 after exhaustive research and genetic testing. Chris is has been involved in the SynGap1 community for several years and has joined SRF to help facilitate access, awareness and one day a treatment/cure for Syngap families.


Email: chris@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Dawn Callery - Treasurer
Full Bio:
Dawn has almost 14 years experience as a parent to a boy with Syngap1-related intellectual disability. Dawn left her career working for British Airways eight years to care for him full time. She has gained extensive experience over that time with various therapies and interventions. Dawn intends to continue to advocate for him so he can successfully access all the support he needs which so far hasn’t been an easy journey. Dawn is honoured to have the opportunity to launch SRF UK. Dawn is from Sheffield but has lived in Surrey the past 24 years she also has a daughter aged 8.


‍

Name: Deanna N. Farley - Social Media
Full Bio:
Deanna is in charge of the #WarriorWednesday posts each week. Currently she is pursuing her career and education in applied behavior analysis. Prior to ABA, she was a nanny for a Syngap1 child for nearly 4 years.

For all inquiries regarding the #WarriorWednesday posts please email: deanna@syngapresearchfund.com

LinkedIn

Twitter

Instagram

Name: Erica Brown - Alabama and Surrounding States
Full Bio:
Erica Brown is a Resource Development Coordinator to an Alabama based nonprofit, providing applied behavior analysis (ABA) therapy to disenfranchised children through residential, preschool, and clinic facilities. For the past 5 years, she has specialized in grant writing and fundraiser planning, providing support to allow the organization to continue to grow, reaching more children.

Erica’s daughter was diagnosed with Syngap1 in 2015, at the age of 5 years old. She has since dedicated her life to promoting Syngap awareness and educating other families on the navigating the processes and knowing what is available for their child.
Email: Erica@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Hans P. Schlecht, MD, MMSc
Full Bio:
Hans trained in Internal Medicine and Infectious Diseases at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and completed a Clinical Investigator Training Program with a Masters in Medical Sciences from Harvard/MIT Health Sciences and Technology. He is a parent to a son with SYNGAP1 deficiency and since March 2017, an advocate for advancing the care and research for this rare disease.

Watch this two minute video produced by RAREis™ featuring Hans.


‍

Name: Jen Cook - Virginia and Surrounding States
Full Bio:
After years of searching for what was Making Jen’s daughter different from her sisters, her and her husband finally got the news in May of 2018 that their daughter, Harper, had a Syngap1 gene mutation. Soon after, in July 2018, came the epilepsy diagnosis. As difficult as this has been on their family, they have found ways to become apart of this very special community of parents fighting to find treatments for their children. Harper is beautiful 3 years old little girl and has a smile that lights up the room!

Jen and John Cook have 4 wonderful children and live in Virginia. Jen is a realtor part time and mom full time. She became apart of the Syngap Research Fund in hopes of helping with fundraising and also helping newly diagnosed families navigate this journey.

Jen recently launched a syngap clothing and accessory line called “The Tiny Rare Ones” which has partnered with the Syngap Research Fund to help raise awareness and funds to find treatments. Check out her website at https://thetinyrareones.itemorder.com/sale﻿

Email: Jen@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Jen Robert
Full Bio:
Jen is a full-time mom, designer, calligrapher and co-founder of a local small business in Greenville, South Carolina. Jen is a proud graduate of Clemson University with a B.A. in Sociology. Shortly after graduating she moved to San Clemente, California where she began her unexpected career as a nanny, eventually leading her to Switzerland to live and work as an au pair. During her career as a nanny she cared for a child with a neurological disorder, which introduced her to the world of special needs long before she had kids of her own. She is now back in her hometown of Greenville, SC where she lives with her husband, Dan, and two daughters, Ivy and Elsie.

Elsie was diagnosed with SYNGAP1 through Whole Exome Sequencing in July of 2020. Jen quickly joined the SynGAP community to learn more about the disorder and gained invaluable insight from parents and volunteers from SynGAP Research Fund. Jen now volunteers her time with SRF with the hopes of supporting the organization in its mission to accelerate science to find a treatment or cure for our kids.

Name: Jess Duggan
Full Bio:
Jessica is a British Citizen based in New York City. She has over 15 years experience working in professional services and banking technology in London, Tokyo, Sydney, and NYC. She holds a Master’s degree in Science and Technology Studies from the University of Edinburgh and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from the University of Sussex. Jessica’s 3 year old daughter received a genetic diagnosis of SynGAP-1 in 2019 after having previously been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder.


‍

Name: Julie Pender - Secretary
Full Bio:
Julie has 15+ years experience working across some of the world's most famous wines and spirits brands like Antinori, Whispering Angel, Jim Beam, House of Suntory, Teacher’s, Grant’s, Hendrick’s, Glenfiddich, The Balvenie, Innis & Gunn, and more. Julie has held key brand leadership roles at William Grant & Sons, Beam Suntory and Berkmann Wine Cellars. Julie is based in London, and is mum to two children, one of whom has Syngap1.


‍

Name: Kali Worth, RN
Full Bio:
Kali Worth has a Bachelor of Science in Nursing. Her nursing experience includes working in a hospital, office, and school setting. She now works full time in human resources. Kali and her husband Lj have two children: Kailyn and Keanu. Their family resides in southeastern North Carolina. They enjoy spending time outdoors together as a family, especially at the beach.

Kailyn was diagnosed with Syngap in December 2019. Upon connecting with members of the SRF team, Kali felt that her family had found their syngap home and quickly became eager to volunteer.

Kailyn recently shared her daughter’s story and how her family is navigating life after a SYNGAP1 diagnosis.

Name: Katrien Deckers
Full Bio:
Katrien started her professional career as an Investment Banker in the Netherlands and then moved to an Investor Relations / fundraising role with a Secondaries private equity firm in London. Katrien now works in Executive Search focused on the Financial Services sector. She is Dutch and currently lives in London, UK. Katrien is mum to three boys, one of which was diagnosed with Syngap in February 2020. Katrien hopes that being part of SRF UK will help improve awareness and therapies for her son Bear.


‍

Name: Laura Ma - Survey
Full Bio:
Laura Ma has a son who was diagnosed with SynGAP1 Syndrome in 2015. Prior to retiring, she was a Director at a management consulting firm. Her areas of specialty while in management consulting included strategy (corporate, marketing, distribution, IT), organizational design/implementation & effectiveness, information technology (strategy, platform/database design and implementation) and regulatory compliance. She received her bachelors from UCLA in Psychology with specializations and concentrations in Business & Administration, Computing, and Developmental Disabilities.

Since her son’s diagnosis, she has immersed herself in understanding his condition and advocates for his well-being, growth, education, and happiness. She credits her son for her tenacity and life perspective.

LinkedIn


‍

Name: Lauren Perry - Colorado and Surrounding States
Full Bio:
Lauren Perry’s son was diagnosed with SYNGAP1 in 2016 at the age of 6 after quite a long journey of trying to understand why he was not developing normally and experiencing such an array of symptoms. She spent countless hours at doctor’s appointments, therapy offices and school meetings for him. When he was diagnosed through whole exome sequencing it felt as though she finally had the anchor she was searching for in the Syngap community. Lauren is a Colorado native and loves spending time in the mountains and participating in outdoor activities as much as the Syngap lifestyle allows. She is very interested in supporting other families as they navigate their diagnosis and is here to help in any way she can.  
Email: Lauren@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Marta Caceres Dahiya, MD
Full Bio:
Marta Caceres Dahiya is a physician. She is originally from Colombia, South America where she studied medicine. She came to the United States of America to complete her medical education and specialized in radiation oncology. She is currently practicing in Fort Worth, Texas. Marta is the mother of a child with Syngap1 disorder.

Marta's role in SRF is in special projects including raising awareness and advocating for Hispanic patients and families. She also assists with our educative mission.

Marta recently wrote an article outlining IUD use in Syngapians which can be found here.  

Twitter
marta@syngapresearchfund.org

Name: Monica Cruz Harding - California and Surrounding States
Full Bio:
Monica Cruz Harding, patient engagement ambassador, received a Bachelor of Science degree in Business from Arizona State University West and a Master of Science degree in Public Administration from the University of Oklahoma. During college, she worked in the banking industry before transitioning to physician office management: health insurance and accounts receiveable. As a military wife, she committed to being a full-time mother to her children. In 2005, motherhood took on a whole new meaning and purpose when her son, Jaxon, was diagnosed with pervasive developmental delays. Monica has helped many navigate the Military Health System ECHO Program and California state's disability resources.  Currently, she is the social events coordinator at the non public school where her son attends, and decompresses by tending to her gardens and working her worm compost.  Monica lives in San Diego, CA, with her husband, Aaron, their two daughters, Natalie, 20, Michaela, 17 and son Jaxon, 13 who was diagnosed with SynGAP1 Syndrome, December 2015.
‍

Email: Monica@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Nancy Kessler, MA
Full Bio:
Nancy Kessler has spent 35 years working in the public schools as an elementary school teacher and case manager of special education students ages 3-21 in New Jersey. She has an Educational Specialist Degree, Ed.S. in School and Community Psychology and most recently received a certificate in Applied Behavior Analysis. Nancy retired after 35 years in education in 2017.Nancy is co-guardian of Caren (Syngapian), soon to be 65. Nancy and her husband have one daughter, Lauren. She has been greatly influenced by Caren's diagnoses. Nancy's family resides in Central-North NJ. They enjoy spending time together, playing tennis and especially time at their summer home in LBI.

Nancy says "My sister was diagnosed with Syngap1 in June 2020 after surviving Covid-19. She will be turning 65 in May 2021. Since her diagnosis, the outpouring of support has been overwhelming and amazing from the SRF community. At the time of her diagnosis, I immersed myself on the internet and researched everything possible that I could find. SRF reached out to me through messenger. They supported a film, Celebrating Caren along with Illumina which told our family story and journey to diagnosis. If my sister's story will help the life of one other, then her survival and journey will have made a difference."

Name: Olga Elizabeth C.Bothe
Full Bio:
Olga’s son, Drew, was diagnosed with a Syngap mutation in June 2013 at five years old. When Drew was not meeting his developmental milestones therapies and testing began in infancy. After four years of exhaustive investigation Drew’s rare condition was confirmed via the whole exome sequencing test granted by Texas Children’s Hospital and Baylor College of Medicine in Houston.  

As the parent of a newly diagnosed child with a rare disease Olga became actively involved in promoting Syngap awareness in addition to facilitating fund raising for medical research.  Determined to further research with the view to finding a treatment for Syngap she discovered Dr. Jimmy Holder, a research neurologist at Baylor College of Medicine.  Dr. Holder’s lab is now a Syngap Center of Excellence.  Olga’s professional background is in the healthcare industry to include sales & marketing in employer group benefits and business development.  She attended Texas State University studying business administration and psychology prior to her healthcare career.

Olga and her husband, Mike, reside in the greater Houston area raising their two children, Sara 15, a high school cheerleader, and Drew, who is now 11 years old, in the 5th grade.  As a family they love to travel and enjoy outdoor activities together.  In addition to promoting Syngap awareness and advocating for Rare Disease Olga is an active member of the Baylor Genetics Patient Advisory Board at Texas Children’s Hospital and also the National Charity League.

Email: Olga@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Olga’s son, Drew, was diagnosed with a Syngap mutation in June 2013 at five years old. When Drew was not meeting his developmental milestones therapies and testing began in infancy. ‍

Name: Pavel Gerovich
Full Bio: Pavel Gerovich is a technology director with a focus on the financial industry and a Syngap dad. He has spent over 13 years building software at J.P. Morgan Chase. After starting his career in New York, Pavel spent 6 years on assignment in Japan and Australia before moving back to the USA in 2015. He received his B.S. in Finance from Bentley University.

Name: Peter Halliburton
Full Bio:
Peter Halliburton is in technology sales and lives in a suburb outside of Dallas, TX. He met his wife, Lindsay, at Texas State University, where he received his bachelor’s degree in Mass Communications — Public Relations. They have a son, Carter, and daughter, Presley.

Carter was diagnosed with SynGAP1 in July 2019 at 2 years-old. Shortly thereafter, Halliburton was introduced to Syngap Research Fund and was inspired by their hyperfocus in accelerating the path to treatments through SRF's core values of Collaboration. Transparency. Urgency. He quickly connected with the team to begin volunteering.

Email: Peter@syngapresearchfund.org

LinkedIn



‍

Name: Rebecca Kohlhepp
Full Bio:
Rebecca Kohlhepp has been an advocate within the Syngap community since 2011 when her daughter was diagnosed, beginning the first Syngap Family Support Group.  Rebecca served as a board member for another US Syngap Organization for close to three years with a focus on Patient Support and Engagement.  Rebecca has recently joined the Syngap Research Fund as Treasurer and is also serving as a regional Patient Ambassador.  Rebecca is an active supporter of Syngap Global Network believing that the greatest impact will be realized through global collaboration.

Email: rebecca@syngapresearchfund.org


‍

Name: Summer Slaght
Full Bio:
Summer’s son, Ryker, was diagnosed with SYNGAP1 mutation January 2015. Looking for the root cause of Ryker’s global developmental delays they began their extensive search traveling to see several different doctors, rounds of genetic tests and continuous therapies of OT, PT and Speech. Ryker’s diagnosis was later confirmed when he was 4.5 years old through the whole exome sequencing (WES) genetic test granted by Shodair Children’s Genetics Hospital in Helena, Montana.

Summer is a 10-year military veteran with the U.S. Coast Guard working in many different facets from drug interdiction and illegal immigration in Caribbean to Support Ops in the Outer Banks of North Carolina and finishing as a Recruiter for 4 years in Seattle, WA.

Summer currently resides in her husband Adam’s hometown of Missoula, Montana with their 3 sons, AJ (13), a Freestyle Team Skier and actor, Brody (10) avid lacrosse player and Ryker (8) lover of revolving doors, elevators and lights. They are business owners of ABR Insulation, LLC a Commercial & Residential Insulation Company. Summer has also managed her independent skincare company for the past 9 years helping others feel their best. She is also very active in her local special needs community co-facilitating a National Special Needs Networking Group – Missoula Circle of Parents. As a family they enjoy boating, camping, hunting and skiing.


Email: Summer@syngapresearchfund.org

Ryker’s diagnosis was later confirmed when he was 4.5 years old through the whole exome sequencing (WES) genetic test granted by Shodair Children’s Genetics Hospital in Helena, Montana.

Name: Victoria Arteaga, MBA
Full Bio:
Victoria Arteaga She is the mother of three daughters Violeta 7, Amelia 4 (syngapian) and Lourdes (3 months old). Amelia was diagnosed in 2018 at the age of 3, from the moment of receiving her daughter's diagnosis and knowing the challenges that the diagnosis represented, especially in Latin America, Victoria and her husband Juan decided to get involved to actively participate and help the Latin American community in order to promote, sensitize inclusion, greater opportunities and seek a cure for the disease.

Victoria Arteaga originally from Colombia is an International Negotiator with a specialization in Geopolitics and whose work life led her to work in important logistics and distribution companies, she moved to Palm Beach Gardens, Florida in 2006 with her husband and is studying an Executive MBA with an emphasis on Operations at Florida Atlantic University.

Victoria Arteaga is a mother of three daughters Violeta (7), Amelia (4) (syngapian) and Lourdes (3 months old). From the moment she received her daughter's diagnosis, she knew the challenges that the diagnosis represented especially in Latin America, Victoria and her husband Juan decide to get involved and actively participate and assist the Latin American community in order to promote, raise awareness, inclusion and seek a cure for this rare disease.

Born in Colombia, with a Bachelors on International Business and graduate studies on Geopolitics. Her career led her to work in important logistics and distribution companies abroad and in the US. She moved to Palm Beach Gardens, Florida in 2006 with her husband, Juan, and graduated from an Executive MBA with an emphasis in Operations at Florida Atlantic University.

Name: Virginie McNamar
Full Bio:
Virginie McNamar is a project manager who graduated with a Master in International Business from France. She worked as a event and volunteer manager, product director for a volunteer management software company and township community outreach director.

Her youngest son was diagnosed with Syngap1 in November 2016 at 16 months old. Since then, she dedicated her free time to help raise awareness, build strong local communities and facilitate global collaboration. She started along with other Syngap parents Syngap Global Network, an international collaboration group.

Email: virginie@syngapresearchfund.org
